data.title: Silent Shorts with live score by Phillip Johnston | 8pm Fri 2 Dec 2022 Fed Square
data.meta_description: Celebrate the start of summer in Fed Square with some silent shorts accompanied by live scores by Phillip Johnston. Cops (Buster Keaton, 1922) and Le voyage dans la lune (Georges Méliès, 1902)
data.text:
Cops, Dir. Buster Keaton, 1922, USA, 18 mins.

After being rebuffed by his sweetheart for not being a savvy businessman, a young man stumbles across a wad of cash that just might be what he needs to prove himself. However, a series of incidents begin to snowball into something quite out of his control.

Le voyage dans la lune (A Trip to the Moon), Dir. Georges Méliès, 1902, France, 13 mins.

In Georges Méliès' pioneering visual effects-laden science-fiction short, a party embarking on an exploratory mission to the moon encounter mysterious creatures.

This very special free performance is co-presented with Fed Square. Arrive early to grab a deckchair or bring your own chair or picnic rug.

Not-So-Silent Cinema has been supported through the Melbourne City Revitalisation Fund, a partnership between the Victorian Government and the City of Melbourne.
